verses.roman:
yadyapi tomāra artha ei śabde kaya
tathāpi 'āśliṣya-doṣe' kahana nā yāya

synonyms: yadyapi—although; tomāra—Your; artha—meaning; ei—this; śabde—by the word; kaya—is said; tathāpi—still; āśliṣya-doṣe—by the fault of ambiguity; kahana—to say; nā—not; yāya—possible.
translation: "Although Your explanation is correct, it should not be used because there is ambiguity in the word 'mukti-pada.'
